title: Senior Employee Relations Manager
content:
Who We Are
At Justworks, you’ll enjoy a welcoming and casual environment, great benefits, wellness program offerings, company retreats, and the ability to interact with and learn from leaders in the startup community. We work hard and care about our most prized asset - our people.
We’re helping businesses get off the ground by enabling them to focus on running their business. We solve HR issues. We’re data-driven and never stop iterating. If you’d like to work in a supportive, entrepreneurial environment, are interested in building something meaningful and having fun while doing it, we’d love to hear from you.
We're united by shared goals and shared motivations at Justworks. These are best summed up in our company values, which are reflected in our product and in our team.
Our Values
If this sounds like you, you’ll fit right in.Who You Are
You are a true HR guru. You know what employees want and how to ensure they are being taken care of on both a personal and professional level. There is no problem too big or too small that you cannot tackle using your extensive HR knowledge and intuition to drive improvements across the business. Your presence fosters trust among employees and the people around you know you have their backs.
As the Senior Employee Relations Manager, you will serve as an employee relations subject matter expert and act as a trusted, supportive advisor across the business, as well as the go-to point of escalation for your People Business Partner and People Operations colleagues, managers, and leaders. In partnership and collaboration with members of the People and Legal teams, you will be responsible for providing the business with ongoing support and consultation on employee related matters such as, but not limited to, employee performance improvement, proactive coaching & development, investigations into employee related concerns, corrective actions, complaint investigations, employee separation, exit interview survey trends, and other employee matters. 
As a Senior Employee Relations Manager, you will report directly to the Director, People Business Partner Group.
Your Success Profile
What You Will Work On

Partner with leaders and employees to provide guidance and support to create strategies and plans to improve employee performance, drive engagement and build a culture of high performance
In partnership with the the People Business Partners and Legal teams, conduct investigations for behavioral/workplace issues in a timely manner, while applying appropriate investigative techniques and strategies with supporting documentation
Create training curriculum and conduct appropriate training for managers and employees in overall manager best practices and performance improvement concepts in alignment with our company’s core values, practices, and processes
Develop resources, tools and standards for employee relations, including employee counseling and engagement, documentation standards and practices, policy interpretation and application, performance management methodologies, investigations, reasonable accommodations, and responses to other sensitive work-related issues
Ensure compliance and effective application of company policies and procedures, as well as federal and state regulations and laws
Improve existing employment practices; develop and draft new policies, document practices, and drive organizational change management as needed
Advise and train managers on best employee relations practices and strategies to help proactively improve overall employee performance and engagement
Provide investigation case trend data and actionable feedback and recommendations to Legal, the People Business Partner team, and senior leadership to reduce overall risk in the organization
Conduct employee exit interviews, summarize findings, and discuss trends and concerns with respective stakeholders
Conduct employee relations metrics and trend analysis with proactive recommendations on policies and programs to address cases, trends, and/or concept
Help promote knowledge, understanding, and compliance with company policy and relevant employment laws through proactive coaching and training for managers and employees alike
Facilitate HR risk assessments regarding employee relations matters to identify and remediate risk
Build a more formal employee relations program and structure at Justworks, in partnership with members of the People and Legal teams 
Other duties as needed based on departmental and/or organizational needs.

How You Will Do Your Work
As a Senior Employee Relations Manager, how results are achieved is paramount for your success and ultimately contribute to our success as an organization. In this role, your foundational knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes are anchored in the following competencies:

Consultative - takes an approach that focuses on building relationships with others, understanding their problems, and developing solutions to their challenges through open-ended questions and active listening.
Solution-oriented - identifies the source of a question or challenge and provides the right, or a better, way of doing things.
Good judgment - the exercise of critical thinking, analyzing and assessing problems and implications, identifying patterns, making connections of underlying issues, understanding risks and developing mitigation strategies, and taking ownership of the outcome.
Functional expertise - subject matter expertise of specific function(s), including knowledge of principles, practices, and domain knowledge.
Clear communication - the ability to articulate thoughts and express ideas effectively using oral, written, visual and non-verbal communication skills, as well as listening skills to gain understanding.

In addition, all Justworkers focus on aligning their behaviors to our core values known as COGIS. It stands for:

Camaraderie - Day to day you can be seen working together toward a higher purpose. You like to have fun. You’re an active listener, treat people respectfully, and have a strong desire to know and help others.
Openness - Your default is to be open. You're willing to share information, understand other perspectives, and consider new possibilities. You’re curious, ask open questions, and are receptive to thoughts and feedback from others.
Grit - You demonstrate grit by having the courage to commit and persevere. You’re committed, earnest, and dive in to get the job done well with a positive attitude.
Integrity - Simply put, do what you say and say what you'll do. You’re honest and forthright, have a strong moral compass, and strive to match your words with your actions while leading by example. 
Simplicity - Be like Einstein: “Everything should be made as simple as possible, but no simpler.” 

Qualifications

Minimum of 8 years of experience in employee relations role with an emphasis on internal employee related investigations and training
Minimum of 3 years of experience managing an employee relations team
Demonstrated knowledge and experience dealing with sophisticated employment issues that drives high performance management, and conflict resolution strategies
Proven experience developing partnerships with business leaders, and other key stakeholders particularly in helping them lead and manage in a fast-paced start-up environment
Expert-level experience in a variety of HR competency areas such as employee relations, performance management, and development, leadership development, and change management 
Comfortable working in a high volume, fast-paced environment; not afraid to "roll up your sleeves" to complete tactical work; with the ability to switch between strategic and tactical work daily
Ability to coach and communicate across all levels of the organization
Strong strategic and operational thinker, with a knack and excitement for solving problems and building solutions oriented processes
Ability to navigate highly confidential information with professional maturity and discretion
Ability to exercise judgment, while balancing time constraints and need for time sensitive resolutions
Ability to resolve conflicts empathetically and diffuse employee related issues, concerns, situations in a timely manner at times
Strong attention to detail and excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to write cohesive emails, summaries, and investigations plans/reports
Consultative, coaching, counseling, and conflict resolution skills; ability to influence and articulate a variety of issues to different audiences, tailoring messages accordingly
Proven knowledge and understanding of HR regulations, laws and industry best practices to ensure compliance with all applicable international, federal, state, and local employment laws
Experience supporting both exempt and nonexempt employee populations

The base wage range for this position based in our New York City Office is targeted at $155,500.00 to $171,050.00 per year.Actual compensation is based on multiple factors that are unique to each candidate, including and not limited to skill set, level of relevant experience, and specific work location.  Salary ranges for positions based in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location. 
For more information about Justworks’ Total Reward Philosophy, including all of the perks and benefits we are proud to offer our team members, please visit Total Rewards @ Justworks. 
Diversity At Justworks
Justworks is committed to maintaining a workplace where diversity of identity, culture, and life experience is the norm and is celebrated authentically and respected consistently. Diversity in our work, our people, and our product drives creativity and innovation, entrepreneurial leadership and integrity, competitiveness, and collaboration throughout our business and in the market. We depend on our differences to make our team stronger, our workplace more dynamic, and our product accessible to all of our customers.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or familial status, disability, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
Our DEIB Report and Our DEI Commitment

demographic_questions.description:
We work hard to reflect the world we want to see by leading with diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging (DEIB) principles and want to ensure that people from all backgrounds and experiences feel welcomed, supported, and empowered to potentially join the Justworks team.

We believe that in order to gather accurate demographic information we need to move beyond traditional questions about gender, race and ethnicity, and sexual orientation in favor of more inclusive and open-ended approaches.  Of course, thinking around these areas is ever-evolving so, wherever applicable please feel free to select "I prefer to self-describe" and then elaborate so we can use your feedback to inform survey selections in the future.

Participation in this survey is completely optional. Any responses you choose to share will not be associated with your application and will not in any way be used in any hiring decision.  We are collecting this information to establish a better understanding of our candidate pool and meet commitments related to DEIB as we seek to be representative of the wider world.

At Justworks, we are building an open, inclusive, and collaborative culture that values people and their individual potential in the collective service of our company, our community, and our customers. Our DEIB mission is to help every Justworker grow with confidence and realize their full potential.  

We are leading the industry by transparently holding ourselves accountable for our representation and culture of inclusion by sharing our progress. Starting in 2022, we are releasing DEIB statistics on an annual basis. We know we can always do more to advance DEIB, but we are also proud of the company we are building, one great Justworker at a time.
